entities.name: ASTRONAUT
entities.description: A professional who travels in space, conducting scientific experiments, maintenance work, and other tasks on a space station

entities.name: SPACE STATION
entities.description: A large spacecraft designed for long-term human habitation in space, serving as a base for scientific research and other activities

entities.name: MISSION CONTROL
entities.description: The ground-based team responsible for monitoring and directing the activities of astronauts and spacecraft in space

entities.name: EARTH
entities.description: The planet that astronauts observe and study from space, providing a unique perspective on its beauty and complexity

entities.name: SCIENTIFIC EXPERIMENTS
entities.description: Research activities conducted by astronauts to advance knowledge in various scientific fields

entities.name: MAINTENANCE WORK
entities.description: Tasks performed by astronauts to ensure the proper functioning of the space station's systems and equipment

entities.name: EXERCISE REGIMEN
entities.description: A structured program of physical activity designed to maintain astronauts' health in microgravity

entities.name: DAILY CHORES
entities.description: Routine tasks such as cleaning, meal preparation, and system checks that are essential for the space station's operation

entities.name: MEALS AND RELAXATION
entities.description: Scheduled breaks for astronauts to eat, socialize, and relax, which are important for maintaining morale and mental well-being

entities.name: FINAL CHECK-IN
entities.description: An evening meeting with mission control to report on the day's activities and receive instructions for the next day

entities.name: SLEEPING QUARTERS
entities.description: The designated area on the space station where astronauts sleep, equipped with sleeping bags to prevent floating

relations: Astronauts live and work on the space station, conducting various tasks and experiments
Astronauts receive instructions and report back to mission control, maintaining constant communication
Astronauts observe and study Earth from space, often finding moments of relaxation and inspiration in the views
Astronauts participate in a morning briefing to plan and coordinate their daily activities
Astronauts conduct scientific experiments as part of their daily work on the space station
Astronauts perform maintenance tasks to ensure the space station's systems are functioning properly
Astronauts follow a strict exercise regimen to maintain their physical health in microgravity
Astronauts are responsible for performing daily chores to maintain the cleanliness and functionality of the space station
Astronauts take scheduled breaks for meals and relaxation, which are crucial for their mental well-being
Astronauts have a final check-in with mission control to report on the day's activities and receive new instructions
Astronauts sleep in designated quarters on the space station, which are equipped to prevent floating
The space station operates under the guidance and support of mission control, which monitors and directs activities
The space station is the location where the morning briefing takes place, facilitating coordination among the crew
The space station serves as the platform for conducting scientific experiments by the astronauts
The space station's systems and equipment require regular maintenance by the astronauts
The space station is equipped with specialized exercise equipment for astronauts to maintain their physical health
The space station's living quarters and systems require daily maintenance and cleaning by the astronauts
The space station provides a setting for astronauts to take breaks, eat, and relax
The space station is the location where astronauts conduct their final check-in with mission control
The space station includes designated sleeping quarters for astronauts to rest and sleep
Mission control provides instructions and guidance during the morning briefing
Mission control receives reports and provides new instructions during the final check-in
